soc.message

Enum SOCPlayerElement.PEType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SOCPlayerElement.PEType>
      • soc.message.SOCPlayerElement.PEType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SOCPlayerElement.PEType>
    Enclosing class:
    SOCPlayerElement

    public static enum SOCPlayerElement.PEType
extends java.lang.Enum<SOCPlayerElement.PEType>
    Player element type list. To send over the network as an int, use getValue(). When received from network as int, use valueOf(int) to convert to SOCPlayerElement.PEType.

    Converted from int constants to enum in v2.3.00 for cleaner design and human-readable serialization for SavedGameModel.

    Since:
    2.3.00

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • UNKNOWN_TYPE

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType UNKNOWN_TYPE
        Type to use when converting from int but value is unknown. Note: valueOf(int) returns null and not this value.
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • CLAY

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType CLAY
        player element types. CLAY has same getValue() as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY; ORE, SHEEP, WHEAT and WOOD values also match SOCResourceConstants.

      • ORE

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType ORE

      • SHEEP

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SHEEP

      • WHEAT

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType WHEAT

      • WOOD

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType WOOD

      • UNKNOWN_RESOURCE

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType UNKNOWN_RESOURCE
        Amount of resources of unknown type; sent in messages about opponents' resources. Also sent as player's total resource count when client joins a game.

        For some loops which send resource types + unknown, this constant's getValue() is 6 (5 known resource types + 1), same numeric value as SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN.

        Before sending this from server, check if game option PLAY_FO is set: May want to send as known resource type instead.

        Not to be confused with UNKNOWN_TYPE.

        Before v2.3.00 this was named UNKNOWN.

        See Also:
        RESOURCE_COUNT

      • ROADS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType ROADS
        Number of Road pieces available to place.

      • SETTLEMENTS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SETTLEMENTS
        Number of Settlement pieces available to place.

      • CITIES

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType CITIES
        Number of City pieces available to place.

      • SHIPS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SHIPS
        Number of Ship pieces available to place.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • NUMKNIGHTS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType NUMKNIGHTS
        Number of knights in player's army; sent after a Soldier card is played.

        If server is older than v2.4.00 (SOCGame.VERSION_FOR_LONGEST_LARGEST_FROM_SERVER): During normal gameplay, "largest army" indicator at client is updated by examining game state, not by SOCGameElements.GEType.LARGEST_ARMY_PLAYER message from server:
        client should update player's number of knights with SOCPlayer.setNumKnights(int), then (for < v2.4.00) game's largest army by calling SOCGame.updateLargestArmy(), then update any related displays.

      • ASK_SPECIAL_BUILD

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType ASK_SPECIAL_BUILD
        For the 6-player board, player element type for asking to build during the Special Building Phase. This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 1 or 0.

        Also used by SavedGameModel, omitted when value is 0.

        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        HAS_SPECIAL_BUILT

      • RESOURCE_COUNT

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType RESOURCE_COUNT
        Total resources this player has available in hand to use, from their hand's SOCResourceSet.getTotal(). Sent only with SOCPlayerElement.SET, not SOCPlayerElement.GAIN or SOCPlayerElement.LOSE.

        Alternately, send that info as part of a SOCDiceResultResources message.

        Games with clients older than v2.0.00 use SOCResourceCount messages instead of this element: Check version against SOCPlayerElement.VERSION_FOR_CARD_ELEMENTS.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        UNKNOWN_RESOURCE

      • LAST_SETTLEMENT_NODE

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType LAST_SETTLEMENT_NODE
        Node coordinate location of this player's most recently placed settlement, or 0. Used for robots during initial placement at the start of a game. Sent only with SOCPlayerElement.SET, not SOCPlayerElement.GAIN or SOCPlayerElement.LOSE.

        Games with clients older than v2.0.00 use SOCLastSettlement messages instead of this element: Check version against SOCPlayerElement.VERSION_FOR_CARD_ELEMENTS.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • PLAYED_DEV_CARD_FLAG

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType PLAYED_DEV_CARD_FLAG
        Has this player played a development card already this turn? Applies to all players if SOCPlayerElement.getPlayerNumber() == -1. This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 1 or 0, never sent with SOCPlayerElement.GAIN or SOCPlayerElement.LOSE.

        Games with clients older than v2.0.00 use SOCSetPlayedDevCard messages instead of this element: Check version against SOCPlayerElement.VERSION_FOR_CARD_ELEMENTS.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • DISCARD_FLAG

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType DISCARD_FLAG
        Is SOCPlayer.getNeedToDiscard() true? This element is 1 if so, otherwise 0 or omitted.

        Not sent to clients over network; used only by SavedGameModel. Clients are sent SOCDiscardRequest instead.

        Since:
        2.3.00

      • HAS_SPECIAL_BUILT

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType HAS_SPECIAL_BUILT
        In 6-player game's Special Building Phase, has the player already Special Built this turn? From SOCPlayer.hasSpecialBuilt(). This element is 1 or 0.

        Not sent to clients over network; used only by SavedGameModel when gameState is GameState.SPECIAL_BUILDING.

        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        ASK_SPECIAL_BUILD

      • NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_DISC

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_DISC
        Dev card stats: Value of SOCPlayer.numDISCCards.

        Not sent to clients over network; used only by SavedGameModel when value > 0.

        Since:
        2.4.50

      • NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_MONO

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_MONO
        Dev card stats: Value of SOCPlayer.numMONOCards.

        Not sent to clients over network; used only by SavedGameModel when value > 0.

        Since:
        2.4.50

      • NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_ROADS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType NUM_PLAYED_DEV_CARD_ROADS
        Dev card stats: Value of SOCPlayer.numRBCards.

        Not sent to clients over network; used only by SavedGameModel when value > 0.

        Since:
        2.4.50

      • NUM_PICK_GOLD_HEX_RESOURCES

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType NUM_PICK_GOLD_HEX_RESOURCES
        For the large sea board, player element type for asking to choose resources from the gold hex after a dice roll, during the WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE game state. This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 0 or to the number of resources to choose. Call SOCPlayer.setNeedToPickGoldHexResources(int).
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • SCENARIO_SVP

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SCENARIO_SVP
        For scenarios on the large sea board, the player's number of Special Victory Points (SVP). This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 0 or to the player's SOCPlayer.getSpecialVP().
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • PLAYEREVENTS_BITMASK

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType PLAYEREVENTS_BITMASK
        For the large sea board, bitmask of flags related to SOCPlayerEvents. This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 0 or to the player's flags from SOCPlayer.getPlayerEvents().
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • SCENARIO_SVP_LANDAREAS_BITMASK

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SCENARIO_SVP_LANDAREAS_BITMASK
        For scenarios on the large sea board, bitmask of land areas for tracking Special Victory Points (SVP). This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 0 or to the player's land areas from SOCPlayer.getScenarioSVPLandAreas().
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • STARTING_LANDAREAS

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType STARTING_LANDAREAS
        Player's starting land area numbers, from SOCPlayer.getStartingLandAreasEncoded(). Sent only at reconnect, because these are also tracked during play at the client. At client, should be set before placing any pieces to avoid SVP scoring problems. Sent as (landArea2 << 8) | landArea1.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT
        For scenario _SC_CLVI on the large sea board, the number of cloth held by this player. This element is SOCPlayerElement.SET to 0 or to the player's cloth count from SOCPlayer.getCloth(). After giving cloth to a player, check their total VP; 2 cloth = 1 Victory Point.

        The board's "general supply" is updated with this element type with SOCPlayerElement.getPlayerNumber() == -1. Each village's cloth count is updated with a PIECEVALUE message.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • SCENARIO_WARSHIP_COUNT

        public static final SOCPlayerElement.PEType SCENARIO_WARSHIP_COUNT
        For scenario game option _SC_PIRI, the player's total number of ships that have been converted to warships. See SOCPlayer.getNumWarships() for details. This element can be SOCPlayerElement.SET or SOCPlayerElement.GAINed. For clarity, if the number of warships decreases, send SOCPlayerElement.SET, never send SOCPlayerElement.LOSE. SOCPlayerElement.GAIN is sent only in response to a player's successful SOCPlayDevCardRequest to convert a ship to a warship.

        If a player is joining a game in progress, the PLAYERELEMENT(SCENARIO_WARSHIP_COUNT) message is sent to their client only after sending their SOCShip piece positions.

        Since:
        2.0.00
